Description¶

Maya dependency graph operations including dependency node modifications and iteration of the graph. For operations specific to plugs and attributes see msTools.core.maya.plug_utils or msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.

Dependencies¶

A dependency is formed when data flows between two connected plugs via a directed edge in the graph. Dependency paths define the flow of data in the dependency graph. They are a product of the internal attributeAffects relationships of nodes and the edges which connect plugs in the graph.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.cacheComponent(sourceComponent, destNode, shortName=None, longName=None)¶

Cache shape node components on a destination node.

A connection will be made from the static 'message' attribute of the souce node to a typed attribute on the destination node. The typed attribute will hold the component data from the source node.

Parameters:
  • sourceComponent ((OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject)) –

    A two-element tuple representing component data to cache on destNode.

    1. Path encapsulation of a shape node.
    2. Wrapper holding OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type date corresponding to components on the shape node.
  • destNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node on which to cache the sourceComponent data.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the new typed attribute used to cache the component data. If None, the longName will be used. If the longName is also None, the short name of the sourceNode will be suffixed by '__components'. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the new typed attribute used to cache the component data. If None, the shortName will be used. If the shortName is also None, the short name of the sourceNode will be suffixed by '__components'. Defaults to None.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the first element of sourceComponent does not reference a shape node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the second element of sourceComponent does not reference component data.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If destNode does not reference a dependency node.
  • RuntimeError – If destNode already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.cacheNode(sourceNode, destNode, shortName=None, longName=None)¶

Cache a dependency node on another dependency node via a message type attribute.

A connection will be made from the static 'message' attribute of the souce node to a message type attribute on the destination node.

Parameters:
  • sourceNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node to cache on destNode.
  • destNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node on which to cache the sourceNode.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourceNode. If None, the longName will be used. If the longName is also None, the sourceNode short name will be used. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourceNode. If None, the shortName will be used. If the shortName is also None, the sourceNode short name will be used. Defaults to None.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If sourceNode or destNode does not reference a dependency node.
  • RuntimeError – If destNode already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.cachePlug(sourcePlug, destNode, shortName=None, longName=None)¶

Cache a dependency node plug on a dependency node.

A connection will be made from the source plug to a message type attribute on the destination node.

Parameters:
  • sourcePlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug to cache on destNode.
  • destNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node on which to cache the sourcePlug.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourcePlug. If None, the longName will be used. If the longName is also None, msTools.core.maya.name_utils.getPlugStorableName() will be used to determine a name for the sourcePlug. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourcePlug. If None, the shortName will be used. If the shortName is also None, msTools.core.maya.name_utils.getPlugStorableName() will be used to determine a name for the sourcePlug. Defaults to None.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If destNode does not reference a dependency node.
  • RuntimeError – If destNode already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.createNode(nodeType)¶

Create a node.

Note

Use msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.createNode() to create a DAG node.

Parameters:nodeType (basestring) – Name of the node type identifier used to create a node.
Raises:ValueError – If nodeType is an invalid node type identifier.
Returns:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper for the new dependency node.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.deleteNode(node)¶

Delete a node.

Note

Use msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.deleteNode() to delete a DAG node.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.disconnectDependencies(root, upstream=False, downstream=False, walk=False, filterTypes=None, forceLocked=False)¶

Disconnect pairs of source and destination plugs for the dependencies of a plug or node.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MPlug | OpenMaya.MObject) – Plug object or wrapper of a dependency node from which to traverse dependencies.
  • upstream (bool, optional) – Whether to disconnect upstream dependencies of root. Defaults to False.
  • downstream (bool, optional) – Whether to disconnect downstream dependencies of root. Defaults to False.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. If root is a node, each connected plug on root acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force disconnect a dependency that is connected via a locked destination plug. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If root is an OpenMaya.MObject but does not reference a dependency node.
  • RuntimeError – If any of the dependencies are connected via a locked destination plug and forceLocked is False.

Example

# Remove direct connections to any constraints downstream of `root`
disconnectDependencies(root, downstream=True, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint,))
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.getCachedComponent(plug, instanceNumber=0)¶

Retrieve cached component data from a dependency node plug. Designed for use with cacheComponent().

Parameters:
  • plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug which holds OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList type data. The plug should be connected to an input shape node which has components corresponding to the data.
  • instanceNumber (int, optional) – Instance number to be used by the path encapsulation of the cached node. Defaults to 0.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug does not reference a typed attribute which holds OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList type data.
  • RuntimeError – If plug is not connected to an input shape node.
  • ValueError – If there is no instance of the cached shape node with corresponding instanceNumber.
Returns:(OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject) – A two-element tuple containing the cached component data.
  1. Path encapsulation of the cached shape node with instanceNumber.
  2. Wrapper of the cached OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type data.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.getCachedNode(plug)¶

Retrieve a cached dependency node from a dependency node plug. Designed for use with cacheNode().

Parameters:

plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug which references a message type attribute and is a destination.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug does not reference a message type attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If plug does not have an input connection.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of the dependency node connected as the input of plug.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.getCachedPlug(plug)¶

Retrieve a cached dependency node plug from a dependency node plug. Designed for use with cachePlug().

Parameters:

plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug which references a message type attribute and is a destination.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug does not reference a message type attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If plug does not have an input connection.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug connected as the input of plug.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.iterDependenciesByEdge(root, directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield dependencies of a plug or node as edges represented by a pair of connected source and destination plugs.

Each pair will correspond to a connection from a source plug to a destination plug regardless of the directionType.

If root is a node, each connected plug on root will be traversed.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on root.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MPlug | OpenMaya.MObject) – Plug object or wrapper of a dependency node from which to traverse dependencies.
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of root. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of root. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. If root is a node, each connected plug on root acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter plug dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If root is an OpenMaya.MObject but does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:

(OpenMaya.MPlug, OpenMaya.MPlug) – A two-element tuple of connected plugs.

  1. A source plug connection for a dependency of root.
  2. A corresponding destination plug connection for a dependency of root.

Together each pair represents a connected edge in the graph.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.iterDependenciesByNode(root, directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield the node dependencies of a plug or node.

If root is a node, each connected plug on root will be traversed. A node is yielded if it has not been visited.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on root.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MPlug | OpenMaya.MObject) – Plug object or wrapper of a dependency node from which to traverse dependencies.
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of root. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of root. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. If root is a node, each connected plug on root acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter node dependencies based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If root is an OpenMaya.MObject but does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers for the node dependencies of root.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.iterDependenciesByPlug(root, directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield the plug dependencies of a plug or node.

If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream, dependencies will correspond to destination plug connections. If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream, dependencies will correspond to source plug connections.

If root is a node, each connected plug on root will be traversed. A plug is yielded if it has not been visited.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on root.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MPlug | OpenMaya.MObject) – Plug object or wrapper of a dependency node from which to traverse dependencies.
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of root. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of root. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. If root is a node, each connected plug on root acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter plug dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If root is an OpenMaya.MObject but does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Plugs for each plug dependency of root.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.iterNodes(filterTypes=None)¶

Yield dependency nodes in the scene.

Parameters:filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter nodes based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Yields:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of dependency nodes in the scene.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.iterSelectedNodes(filterTypes=None)¶

Yield dependency nodes in the active selection.

Parameters:filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter selected nodes based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Yields:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of dependency nodes in the active selection.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.lockNode(node)¶

Lock a node.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
Returns:bool – True if the lock state of node has changed, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.renameNode(node, name)¶

Rename a node.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of an unlocked dependency node.
  • name (basestring) – New name for node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • RuntimeError – If node is locked.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.setCachedComponent(sourceComponent, destPlug, forceLocked=False)¶

Update shape node components which are cached on a dependency node via a plug holding OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList data.

A connection will be made from the static 'message' attribute of the souce node to an existing typed attribute. The existing typed attribute will be updated to hold the component data from the source node.

Parameters:
  • sourceComponent ((OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject)) –

    A two-element tuple used to update the component data of destPlug.

    1. Path encapsulation of a shape node.
    2. Wrapper holding OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type date corresponding to components on the shape node.
  • destPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug holding OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList data.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force the update if destPlug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the first element of sourceComponent does not reference a shape node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the second element of sourceComponent does not reference component data.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If destPlug does not hold OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList data.
  • RuntimeError – If destPlug is locked and forceLocked is False.
msTools.core.maya.dg_utils.unlockNode(node)¶

Unlock a node.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
Returns:bool – True if the lock state of node has changed, otherwise False.
